remarks: Lemma for ~ lclkr .  Restate the hypotheses for ` E ` and ` G ` to say their kernels are closed, in order to eliminate the generating vectors ` X ` and ` Y ` .  (Contributed by NM, 18-Jan-2015.)
statement:
lclkrlem2y.l $e |- L = ( LKer ` U ) $.
lclkrlem2y.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
lclkrlem2y.o $e |- ._|_ = ( ( ocH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lclkrlem2y.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
lclkrlem2y.f $e |- F = ( LFnl ` U ) $.
lclkrlem2y.d $e |- D = ( LDual ` U ) $.
lclkrlem2y.p $e |- .+ = ( +g ` D ) $.
lclkrlem2y.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
lclkrlem2y.e $e |- ( ph -> E e. F ) $.
lclkrlem2y.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. F ) $.
lclkrlem2y.le $e |- ( ph -> ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` E ) ) ) = ( L ` E ) ) $.
lclkrlem2y.lg $e |- ( ph -> ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` G ) ) ) = ( L ` G ) ) $.
lclkrlem2y $p |- ( ph -> ( ._|_ ` ( ._|_ ` ( L ` ( E .+ G ) ) ) ) = ( L ` ( E .+ G ) ) ) $.
